What can I say? It's CS:GO, it's popular and it's easy to get going. You will quickly learn the guns' names and callouts for your teammates. It is a must to have teammates you trust and know, else you will fail in your executes. It is a team/strategy based game, meaning you rely on having good teammates who give clear callouts and a lot of game sense. For example you will know how long it takes the enemies to rotate from site to site, giving you an approximate of when they will be where. Of couse that needs a lot of training, but you learn by time. Of course you will not be a pro in your first game, as you have a lot to learn. If you are stuck and don't know how to improve, then watch some videos on YouTube, or watch professionals play. They will probably show you some good tactics/nade lineups. You can find many good tutorials in the web. Skins really don't matter if you ask me. I have a bunch of skins worth a bit, but it is in no way a must, you can play without them. If you were wondering, they don't give you any advantages; it's just a virtual item that changes the looks of the guns in the game.
Fun game, fun to play with friends, also big community!

Great game with a very high skill cap making it enjoyable to continually grind to become better. The only downside to this game and unpopular opinion is the ranking system. I really do not have a problem with getting into game with cheaters although I have had prime since I was high enough level for it. If just starting out and need someone to play with add me and we shall que and end noobs.
